item.name: Abaddon's Reach (Exalted)
entries: This longsword has a hilt which is in the shape of a mask with 6 eye slits, and tentacles coming out of it's back, making up the pommel.
'Act with magic, act within reason, act without mercy.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use Abaddon's Reach as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Abaddon's Reach is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 psychic damage.

• You gain an additional volatile 3rd level spell slot. Immediately after you cast a spell using that spell slot, roll a d20. If you roll a 1, roll on the Wild Magic Surge table to create a random magical effect, otherwise the number you need to roll increases by 1, until you trigger a roll on the Wild Magic Surge table, at which point it will reset to 1. A Wild Magic Surge can happen once per turn. You regain this spell slot when you finish a short or long rest.
{@bold Awakened.} When Abaddon's Reach reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra psychic damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.
• The level of your additional spell slot increases to 5th level.
{@bold Exalted.} When Abaddon's Reach reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra psychic damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.
• The level of your additional spell slot increases to 7th level.
{@bold Mastery: Sap.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.

item.name: Seeker (Exalted)
entries: This light crossbow is in the shape of a dragon's wing.
'Tyria's last hope rests on the unity of the races. The pooling of their strength. It is the only way.' is inscribed on the grip.
You can use Seeker as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Seeker is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 piercing damage.

• The first attack roll you make with this weapon each turn scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20, if your target is within 5 feet of an ally of yours. If another feature or trait already gives you an increased critical hit range, increase that range by one instead.
{@bold Awakened.} When Seeker reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra piercing damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• At the end of a short rest you can choose one of the following damage types; Acid, Cold, Fire, Lightning, Piercing or Poison. Any bolt shot from this weapon and the extra damage of this weapon now deal damage of the damage type chosen and are considered magical. You can also change the damage type as a bonus action by expending a spell slot of level 1+.
{@bold Exalted.} When Seeker reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra piercing damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.

• The first attack roll you make with this weapon each turn scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20, if you attack with advantage. If another feature or trait already gives you an increased critical hit range, increase that range by one instead.

{@bold Mastery: Slow.} If you hit a creature with this weapon and deal damage to it, you can reduce its Speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn. If the creature is hit more than once by weapons that have this property, the Speed reduction doesn't exceed 10 feet.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Brotherhood of the Dragon

item.name: The Core (Exalted)
entries: This flaming longsword is made of ornamented deldrimor steel, with a heavy core of infernal iron.
'Offer protection to the weak. Give solace and shelter to those who need it. Be ye a salve to the wounded.' is inscribed on the blade.
You can use The Core as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While The Core is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 fire damage.

• On your turn, when you score a critical hit against a creature with The Core or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you gain temporary hit points equal to the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
{@bold Awakened.} When The Core reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra fire damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• On your turn, when you score a critical hit against a creature with The Core or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can cause flames to erupt, damaging creatures of you choice within 10 feet of you, equal to the challenge rating of the creature or your proficiency bonus, whichever is higher.
{@bold Exalted.} When The Core reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra fire damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.

• Once on your turn, when you score a critical hit against a creature with The Core or reduce a creature to 0 hit points with it, you can make one extra melee weapon attack as part of your attack action.
{@bold Mastery: Sap.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, that creature has Disadvantage on its next attack roll before the start of your next turn.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Core Warband

item.name: Celestial Slicer (Exalted)
entries: This silver-bladed sickle glimmers softly with moonlight. When looking at the reflection on the blade you can see the night sky.
'Lead through actions, not words!' is inscribed on the silver blade.
You can use the Celestial Slicer as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
You can use the Celestial Slicer as a star map while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While the Celestial Slicer is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 radiant damage.

• When you make ranged spell attack roll against a creature, you can target one additional creature and make a second attack roll against it. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
{@bold Awakened.} When the Celestial Slicer reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra radiant damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.

• If you cast a spell with a spell slot of 1st level or higher and target an ally with the spell, that ally can use their reaction immediately after the spell to make one weapon attack against a creature of your choice that you can see. If the spell targets more than one ally, you choose the ally who can make the attack.
{@bold Exalted.} When the Celestial Slicer reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra radiant damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.
• You can maintain concentration on two spells. When making a Constitution saving throw to maintain concentration, make one for each concentration.

{@bold Mastery: Nick.} When you make the extra attack of the Light property, you can make it as part of the Attack action instead of as a Bonus Action. You can make this extra attack only once per turn.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Ascalon Vanguard

item.name: Incursion Breaker (Exalted)
entries: This staff is imbued with powerful arcane magic.
'Our gift to the people of Tyria is that they never know just how much danger they've been in.' is inscribed along the shaft of the staff.
You can use Incursion Breaker as a spellcasting focus for your spells while attuned to it.
{@bold Dormant.} While Incursion Breaker is in a dormant state, you gain the following benefits:
• You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with this magic weapon.
• You gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your spells.
• When you hit with an attack using this weapon, the target takes an extra 1d6 cold damage.
• When you make ranged spell attack roll against a creature, which has been hit by your Tentacle of the Deeps this turn, you can give yourself advantage on that roll.

• When you force a creature to make a saving throw to take half damage, which has been hit by your Tentacle of the Deeps this turn, you can give that target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw made against the spell.
{@bold Awakened.} When Incursion Breaker reaches an awakened state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +2.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +2.
• The extra cold damage dealt by the weapon increases to 2d6.
• Once per turn, you can add your proficiency bonus to one damage roll of any spell or class feature, that requires a ranged spell attack roll or which forces a creature to make a saving throw.
{@bold Exalted.} When Incursion Breaker reaches an exalted state, you gain the following benefits:
• The weapon's bonus to attack rolls increases to +3.
• The bonus to spell attack rolls and your spell save DC increases to +3.
• The extra cold damage dealt by the weapon increases to 3d6.

• You can deal maximum damage, instead of rolling for any spell or class feature, that requires a ranged spell attack roll or which forces a creature to make a saving throw. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus and regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

{@bold Mastery: Topple.} If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw (DC 8 plus the ability modifier used to make the attack roll and your Proficiency Bonus). On a failed save, the creature has the Prone condition.
item.reqAttune: by a member of the Wizard's Court

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Akemi the Medic casts one of the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Akemi the Medic makes two attacks, using Mace or Radiant Flame in any combination.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) Bludgeoning damage plus 7 ({@damage 3d4}) Radiant damage.

action.name: Radiant Flame
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 8}, range 60 ft. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d10}) Radiant damage.
Loot:
1 Enspelled Staff (Level 1) (Remove Hex, with 6 charges, reduced by 1 for each time she casts it.)  (Unidentified)
If resurrect was not cast:
1 Ruby worth 325 GP and 1 Opal worth 355 GP.

bonus.name: Divine Aid (5/Day)
entries: Akemi the Medic casts {@spell banish|GuildWars}, {@spell Healing Breeze|GuildWars}, {@spell Healing Whisper|GuildWars}, {@spell Holy Strike|GuildWars}, {@spell Heal Other|GuildWars} or {@spell healing touch|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the akemi the medic fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the akemi the medic to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the akemi the medic drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Akemi the Medic casts {@spell Healing Hands|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Azume the Musician casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Azume the Musician makes three Rapier.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Beguiling Song
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}, each creature in a 20-foot-radius {@variantrule Sphere [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Sphere} centered on a point within 120 feet. {@actSaveFail} 20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition until the end of the performer's next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.
Loot:
1 Potion of Healing

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Azume the Musician casts {@spell Illusionary Weaponry|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Captain Manzo makes three attacks, using Rapier or Light Crossbow in any combination.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, and the pirate has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 30/90 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Piercing damage.

bonus.name: {@spell Banishing Smite} {@recharge 4}
entries: The target hit by the attack roll takes an extra {@damage 5d10} Force damage from the attack. If the attack reduces the target to 50 Hit Points or fewer, the target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be transported to a harmless demiplane for the duration. While there, the target has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. When the spell ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in the nearest unoccupied space if that space is occupied.

reaction.name: Riposte
entries: {@actTrigger} Captain Manzo is hit by a melee attack roll while holding a weapon. {@actResponse} Captain Manzo adds 3 to its AC against that attack, possibly causing it to miss. On a miss, Captain Manzo makes one Rapier attack against the triggering creature if within range.
Loot:
1 Potion of Gaseous Form (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the captain manzo fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the captain manzo to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the captain manzo drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Captain Manzo casts {@spell Flourish|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Captain Manzo casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}, +6 to hit with spell attacks.)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: First Mate Sakai makes two attacks, using Shortsword or Longbow in any combination.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) Piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Piercing damage if the attack was made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atkr r} {@hit 7}, range 150/600 ft. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) Piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Piercing damage if the attack was made with {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Aim
entries: First Mate Sakai has {@variantrule Advantage|XPHB} on the next attack roll it makes during the current turn.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: {@actTrigger} First Mate Sakai is hit by an attack roll. {@actResponse} First Mate Sakai halves the damage (round down) it takes from that attack.
Loot:
1 Moon-Touched Greatsword (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the first mate sakai fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: First Mate Sakai casts {@spell Spike Trap|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

legendary.name: Operate Cannon
entries: First Mate Sakai either takes the utilize action to load or aim the cannon, or the Cannonball action to fire it.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: First Mate Sakai casts one of the following spells, using Dexterity as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks.)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 14}):
footerEntries: *Nai the Cook casts these spells on himself before combat.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mage makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Lightning Burst
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) Lightning damage.
Loot:
1 Potion of Climbing (Unidentified)

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the nai the cook fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude
entries: If damage reduces the nai the cook to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 5 + the damage taken, unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the nai the cook drops to 1 hit point instead.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Nai the Cook casts {@spell Glimmering Mark|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

bonus.name: Misty Step (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts {@spell Misty Step|XPHB}, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

reaction.name: Protective Magic (3/Day)
entries: The mage casts {@spell Counterspell|XPHB} or {@spell Shield|XPHB} in response to the spell's trigger, using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Oswald casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability:

trait.name: Stench
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 13}, any creature that starts its turn in a 5-foot {@variantrule Emanation [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Emanation} originating from Oswald. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the start of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} The target is immune to Oswald's Stench for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Oswald makes two Horrific Necrosis attacks. It can replace one attack with a Claw attack.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 6}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Slashing damage. If the target isn't an Undead, it has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Horrific Necrosis
entries: {@atkr m,r} {@hit 7}, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) Necrotic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn.
Loot:
1 Periapt of Wound Closure (Unidentified)

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Oswald casts {@spell Wither|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

trait.name: One with the Woods
entries: While the hag remains motionless in forest terrain, she is indistinguishable from an old, decomposing log or tree stump.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The wood hag has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The wood hag can communicate with Beasts and Plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Woodland Walk
entries: Difficult terrain composed of plants doesn't cost the wood hag extra movement. In addition, she can pass through plants without being slowed by them and without taking damage from them if they have thorns, spines, or a similar hazard.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The wood hag makes two Claw or Toxic Splinter attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.

action.name: Toxic Splinter
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. While {@condition poisoned} in this way, the target is {@condition paralyzed}. A {@condition poisoned} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature within 5 feet of the target can take its action to remove the splinter with a successful {@dc 13} Wisdom ({@skill Medicine}) check, ending the {@condition poisoned} condition on the target.

bonus.name: Nettling Word
entries: The wood hag heckles, mocks, or jeers at one creature she can see within 30 feet of her. If the creature can hear and understand the hag, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw or become enraged until the end of its next turn. While enraged, a creature has advantage on melee attack rolls, is unable to distinguish friend from foe, and must move to and attack the nearest creature other than the hag. If no other creature is near enough to move to and attack, the enraged creature stalks off in a random direction. Attack rolls against an enraged creature have advantage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The wood hag casts one of the following spells, requiring no material components and using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}):

entries: Loot:
1 Lock of Trickery (Unidentified)

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Arboria Woodcurse casts {@spell Fevered Dreams|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
entries: The necromancer magically summons five {@creature skeleton||skeletons} or {@creature zombie||zombies}. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 ({@damage 2d8}) hit points.

While the war between the White Mantle and the Shining Blade tears apart her Krytan homeland, Livia risks everything to keep her people safe. She joined the Shining Blade to protect them; she killed to defend them. Now freed from the control of the deadly Mursaat, Kryta struggles to survive, its leaders destroyed and its population beset by civil disorder.

Tasked by her superiors with finding a way to end the civil war, Livia has traveled into the Depths. She seeks a weapon of power—anything that will keep Kryta safe. And she is willing to give her life for it... as well as the lives of those around her.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the beholder fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The beholder uses Eye Rays three times.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 8}, reach 5 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder randomly shoots one of the following magical rays at a target it can see within 120 feet of itself (roll {@dice 1d10}; reroll if the beholder has already used that ray during this turn):

items.name: 1: Charm Ray
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Charmed|XPHB} condition for 1 hour or until it takes damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 2: Paralyzing Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Paralyzed|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. After 1 minute, it succeeds automatically.

items.name: 3: Fear Ray
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 14 ({@damage 4d6}) Psychic damage, and the target has the {@condition Frightened|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 4: Slowing Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 18 ({@damage 4d8}) Necrotic damage. Until the end of the target's next turn, the target's {@variantrule Speed|XPHB} is halved; the target can't take Reactions; and it can take either an action or a {@variantrule Bonus Action|XPHB} on its turn, not both. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 5: Enervation Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 13 ({@damage 3d8}) Poison damage, and the target has the {@condition Poisoned|XPHB} condition until the end of its next turn. While {@condition Poisoned|XPHB}, the target can't regain {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage only.

items.name: 6: Telekinetic Ray
entries: {@actSave str} {@dc 16} (the target succeeds automatically if it is Gargantuan). {@actSaveFail} The beholder moves the target up to 30 feet in any direction. The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder has the {@condition Incapacitated|XPHB} condition. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a tool or opening a door or container.

items.name: 7: Sleep Ray
entries: {@actSave wis} {@dc 16} (the target succeeds automatically if it is a Construct or an Undead). {@actSaveFail} The target has the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute. The condition ends if the target takes damage or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to wake it.

items.name: 8: Petrification Ray
entries: {@actSave con} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail 1} The target has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition and repeats the save at the end of its next turn if it is still {@condition Restrained|XPHB}, ending the effect on itself on a success. {@actSaveFail 2} The target has the {@condition Petrified|XPHB} condition instead of the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition.

items.name: 9: Disintegration Ray
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 36 ({@damage 8d8}) Force damage. If the target is a nonmagical object or a creation of magical force, a 10-foot {@variantrule Cube [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cube} of it disintegrates into dust. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} If the target is a creature and this damage reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}, it disintegrates into dust.

items.name: 10: Death Ray
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 16}. {@actSaveFail} 55 ({@damage 10d10}) Necrotic damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage. {@actSaveSuccessOrFail} The target dies if the ray reduces it to 0 {@variantrule Hit Points|XPHB}.

bonus.name: Antimagic Cone
entries: The beholder's central eye emits an antimagic wave in a 150-foot {@variantrule Cone [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Cone}. Until the start of the beholder's next turn, that area acts as an {@spell Antimagic Field|XPHB} spell, and that area works against the beholder's own Eye Rays.

legendary.name: Chomp
entries: The beholder makes two Bite attacks.

legendary.name: Glare
entries: The beholder uses Eye Rays.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: Mad King Thorn casts {@spell Virulence|GuildWars} using the same spellcasting ability as Spellcasting.
Loot:
Staff of Flowers
Sending Stones

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Mad King Thorn casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks.)

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks.

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 7}, reach 10 ft. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) Slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shard Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 14}, each creature in a 30-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 49 ({@damage 14d6}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

Bone Dragons are found throughout the Kryta region in the Prophecies campaign. Bone Dragons as we see them are only half of their original bodies, the lower half having torn off due to the pure strength of the Bone Dragons' forearms when they were risen from their graves.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The dragon casts one of the following spells, requiring no Material components and using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks):

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dragon can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day, or 4/Day in Lair)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon makes three Rend attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting to cast {@spell Deathly Swarm|GuildWars} (level 3 version).

action.name: Rend
entries: {@atkr m} {@hit 11}, reach 10 ft. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) Slashing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) Piercing damage.

action.name: Shard Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: {@actSave dex} {@dc 18}, each creature in a 60-foot-long, 5-foot-wide {@variantrule Line [Area of Effect]|XPHB|Line}. {@actSaveFail} 54 ({@damage 12d8}) Piercing damage. {@actSaveSuccess} Half damage.

legendary.name: Elite Spell
entries: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Feast of Corruption|GuildWars}. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Frightful Presence
entries: The dragon uses Spellcasting to cast {@spell Fear|XPHB}. The dragon can't take this action again until the start of its next turn.

legendary.name: Pounce
entries: The dragon can move up to half its {@variantrule Speed|XPHB}, and it makes one Rend attack.

Rotscale is a mighty reanimated dragon from the Shiverpeak Mountains, near the Frost Gate and recently made a trek to Kryta, where many adventurers attempted to slay it. Eventually, Rotscale reached the border of the Maguuma Jungle, in Majesty's Rest, where it currently resides with its small but powerful undead army, including several Rotting Dragons. Rumors claim that Rotscale guards treasure, supposedly a weapon of value.

legendaryGroup.name: Bone Dragon
regionalEffects: The region containing an adult or ancient bone dragon's lair is warped by its presence, creating the following effects:

items.name: Bone Spikes
entries: Bone spikes cover the area within 1 mile of the lair, rendering that area {@variantrule Difficult Terrain|XPHB}. Travel for creatures other than the dragon and its allies takes twice the usual time in that area.

items.name: Corrupted Water
entries: Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally corrupted. A creature that drinks such water must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or have the {@condition Unconscious|XPHB} condition for 1 minute.

regionalEffects: If the dragon dies or moves its lair elsewhere, these effects end immediately.
